channel.title: CVE Feed for F5 Networks, Inc. -- BIG-IP (APM)
channel.description: The latest CVEs for F5 Networks, Inc. -- BIG-IP (APM)

item.title: CVE-2018-5544|2024-09-16T16:53:28.245Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20%28apm%29
item.description: When the F5 BIG-IP APM 13.0.0-13.1.1 or 12.1.0-12.1.3 renders certain pages (pages with a logon agent or a confirm box), the BIG-IP APM may disclose configuration information such as partition and agent names via URI parameters.

item.title: CVE-2018-5528|2024-09-16T17:58:02.368Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20%28apm%29
item.description: Under certain conditions, TMM may restart and produce a core file while processing APM data on BIG-IP 13.0.1 or 13.1.0.4-13.1.0.7.

item.title: CVE-2019-6596|2024-09-16T17:42:59.727Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20%28apm%29
item.description: In BIG-IP 14.0.0-14.0.0.2, 13.0.0-13.1.1.1, 12.1.0-12.1.3.6, 11.6.1-11.6.3.2, or 11.5.1-11.5.8, when processing fragmented ClientHello messages in a DTLS session TMM may corrupt memory eventually leading to a crash. Only systems offering DTLS connections via APM are impacted.

item.title: CVE-2018-5536|2024-09-16T17:18:15.658Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20%28apm%29
item.description: A remote attacker via undisclosed measures, may be able to exploit an F5 BIG-IP APM 13.0.0-13.1.0.7 or 12.1.0-12.1.3.5 virtual server configured with an APM per-request policy object and cause a memory leak in the APM module.
